lead_paragraph: The World Anti-Doping Agency held off on banning the use of hypoxic chambers, but asked that studies look further into health implications. Many athletes use hypoxic or hyperbaric tents and chambers to replicate high-altitude conditions and increase levels of oxygen-rich red blood cells. The ethics committee ruled yesterday that the chambers enhanced performance and violated “the spirit of sport,” but the executive committee refrained from adding them to their list of prohibited substances and methods for 2007.
